text: Jill Wendy Dando (9 November 1961 – 26 April 1999) was an English television presenter. ==Life== Dando's parents were Jack Dando (February 1918 – February 2009) and Winifred Mary Jean Hockey (August 1918 – January 1986). Her older brother, Nigel, worked as a journalist for BBC Radio Bristol before retiring in 2017. Before working for the BBC, he worked as a journalist in local newspapers. Jill grew up in Weston-super-Mare, Somerset. She moved to London in the 1980s. Dando worked as a journalist and newsreader. She presented the travel programme Holiday as well as Crimewatch. She was engaged to Alan Farthing for the last few months of her life. ==Death== On April 26, 1999, Dando was shot on her doorstep in Fulham, west London. She was taken to Charing Cross Hospital where she died at 13:03. ==Trial== Barry George was convicted of her murder in 2001. He was freed in 2008 when his retrial found him not guilty. ==References== Category:1961 births Category:1999 deaths Category:English journalists Category:English murder victims Category:English television presenters Category:Murders by firearm in England Category:People murdered in London Category:Television personalities from Somerset Category:Unsolved murders
title: Jill Dando
